member.name: T:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeMigrationSqlGenerator
member.summary: Provider to convert provider agnostic migration operations into SQL commands that can be run against a Microsoft SQL Server Compact Edition database.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeMigrationSqlGenerator.Generate(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Data.Entity.Migrations.Model.MigrationOperation},System.String)
member.summary: Converts a set of migration operations into Microsoft SQL Server specific SQL.
member.param: Token representing the version of SQL Server being targeted (i.e. "2005", "2008").
member.returns: A list of SQL statements to be executed to perform the migration operations.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeMigrationSqlGenerator.Generate(System.Data.Entity.Migrations.Model.UpdateDatabaseOperation)
member.summary: Generates the specified update database operation which represents applying a series of migrations. The generated script is idempotent, meaning it contains conditional logic to check if individual migrations have already been applied and only apply the pending ones.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeMigrationSqlGenerator.Generate(System.Data.Entity.Migrations.Model.MigrationOperation)
member.summary: Generates SQL for a . Allows derived providers to handle additional operation types. Generated SQL should be added using the Statement method.
member.param: The operation to produce SQL for.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeMigrationSqlGenerator.CreateConnection
member.summary: Creates an empty connection for the current provider. Allows derived providers to use connection other than .
member.returns: An empty connection for the current provider.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeMigrationSqlGenerator.Generate(System.Data.Entity.Migrations.Model.CreateProcedureOperation)
member.summary: Generates the specified create procedure operation.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeMigrationSqlGenerator.Generate(System.Data.Entity.Migrations.Model.AlterProcedureOperation)
member.summary: Generates the specified alter procedure operation.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeMigrationSqlGenerator.Generate(System.Data.Entity.Migrations.Model.DropProcedureOperation)

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeMigrationSqlGenerator.Generate(System.Data.Entity.Migrations.Model.CreateTableOperation)
member.summary: Generates SQL for a . Generated SQL should be added using the Statement method.
member.param: The operation to produce SQL for.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeMigrationSqlGenerator.Generate(System.Data.Entity.Migrations.Model.AlterTableOperation)
member.summary: Override this method to generate SQL when the definition of a table or its attributes are changed. The default implementation of this method does nothing.
member.param: The operation describing changes to the table.

member.summary: Generates SQL to mark a table as a system table. Generated SQL should be added using the Statement method.
member.param: The table to mark as a system table.
The to write the generated SQL to.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeMigrationSqlGenerator.Generate(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Generates SQL to specify a constant byte[] default value being set on a column. This method just generates the actual value, not the SQL to set the default value.
member.returns: SQL representing the default value.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeMigrationSqlGenerator.Name(System.String)
member.summary: Generates a quoted name. The supplied name may or may not contain the schema.
member.returns: The quoted name.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeMigrationSqlGenerator.Quote(System.String)
member.summary: Quotes an identifier for SQL Server.
member.returns: The quoted identifier.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeMigrationSqlGenerator.Statement(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a new Statement to be executed against the database.
member.param: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this statement should be performed outside of the transaction scope that is used to make the migration process transactional. If set to true, this operation will not be rolled back if the migration process fails.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeMigrationSqlGenerator.Writer
member.summary: Gets a new that can be used to build SQL. This is just a helper method to create a writer. Writing to the writer will not cause SQL to be registered for execution. You must pass the generated SQL to the Statement method.
member.returns: An empty text writer to use for SQL generation.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeMigrationSqlGenerator.Statement(System.Data.Entity.Migrations.Utilities.IndentedTextWriter)
member.summary: Adds a new Statement to be executed against the database.
member.param: The writer containing the SQL to be executed.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeMigrationSqlGenerator.StatementBatch(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Breaks string into one or more statements, handling T-SQL utility statements as necessary.
member.param: The SQL to split into one ore more statements to be executed.

Gets or sets a value indicating whether this statement should be performed outside of the transaction scope that is used to make the migration process transactional. If set to true, this operation will not be rolled back if the migration process fails.

member.name: P:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeMigrationSqlGenerator.GuidColumnDefault
member.summary: Returns the column default value to use for store-generated GUID columns when no default value is explicitly specified in the migration. Always returns newid() for SQL Compact.

member.name: T:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeProviderServices
member.summary: The ProviderServices object for the Sql CE provider
member.remarks: Note that instance of this type also resolves additional provider services for Microsoft SQL Server Compact Edition when this type is registered as an EF provider either using an entry in the application's config file or through code-based registration in . The services resolved are: Requests for are resolved to a Singleton instance of to create connections to SQL Compact by default. Requests for for the invariant name "System.Data.SqlServerCe.4.0" are resolved to instances to provide default Migrations SQL generation for SQL Compact.

member.name: F:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeProviderServices.ProviderInvariantName
member.summary: This is the well-known string using in configuration files and code-based configuration as the "provider invariant name" used to specify Microsoft SQL Server Compact Edition 4.0 for ADO.NET and Entity Framework provider services.

member.name: F:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeProviderServices.Instance
member.summary: Singleton object;

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeProviderServices.DbCreateDatabaseScript(System.String,System.Data.Entity.Core.Metadata.Edm.StoreItemCollection)
member.summary: API for generating script for creating schema objects from the Store Item Collection.
member.returns: T-SQL script for generating schema objects.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeProviderServices.DbDatabaseExists(System.Data.Common.DbConnection,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Data.Entity.Core.Metadata.Edm.StoreItemCollection)
member.summary: API for checkin whether database exists or not. This will internally only check whether the file that the connection points to exists or not. Note: In case of SQLCE, timeout and storeItemCollection parameters are ignored.
member.returns: Bool indicating whether database exists or not.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeProviderServices.DbDatabaseExists(System.Data.Common.DbConnection,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Lazy{System.Data.Entity.Core.Metadata.Edm.StoreItemCollection})
member.summary: API for checkin whether database exists or not. This will internally only check whether the file that the connection points to exists or not. Note: In case of SQLCE, timeout and storeItemCollection parameters are ignored.
member.returns: Bool indicating whether database exists or not.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeProviderServices.DbDeleteDatabase(System.Data.Common.DbConnection,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Data.Entity.Core.Metadata.Edm.StoreItemCollection)
member.summary: API for deleting the database. In SQLCE case, this will translate to File.Delete() call. Note: Timeout and storeItemCollection parameters are ignored.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeProviderServices.DbCreateDatabase(System.Data.Common.DbConnection,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Data.Entity.Core.Metadata.Edm.StoreItemCollection)
member.summary: API for creating the databse and schema objects given a StoreItemCollection. This will do following things: 1. Create a new database using SqlCeEngine.CreateDatabase(). 2. Generate scripts for creating schema objects. 3. Execute the scrip generated in step2.

member.param: The connection to receive information for.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeFunctions.Stuff(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)
member.summary: Inserts a string into another string. It deletes a specified length of characters in the target string at the start position and then inserts the second string into the target string at the start position.
member.returns: A string consisting of the two strings.
member.param: The character position in stringinput where the replacement string is to be inserted.
The number of characters to delete from stringInput . If length is longer than stringInput , deletion occurs up to the last character in stringReplacement .
The substring to be inserted into stringInput .

member.summary: A mathematical function that returns the angle, in radians, whose cosine is the specified numerical value. This angle is called the arccosine.

member.returns: An angle, measured in radians.

member.summary: A mathematical function that returns the angle, in radians, whose sine is the specified numerical value. This angle is called the arcsine.
member.returns: An angle, measured in radians.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeFunctions.Atan(System.Nullable{System.Double})
member.summary: A mathematical function that returns the angle, in radians, whose tangent is the specified numerical value. This angle is called the arctangent.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeFunctions.Atan(System.Nullable{System.Decimal})
member.summary: A mathematical function that returns the angle, in radians, whose tangent is the specified numerical value. This angle is called the arctangent.
member.returns: An angle, measured in radians.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeFunctions.Atan2(System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{System.Double})
member.summary: Returns the positive angle, in radians, between the positive x-axis and the ray from the origin through the point (x, y), where x and y are the two specified numerical values. The first parameter passed to the function is the y-value and the second parameter is the x-value.
member.returns: An angle, measured in radians.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeFunctions.Atan2(System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.Nullable{System.Decimal})
member.summary: Returns the positive angle, in radians, between the positive x-axis and the ray from the origin through the point (x, y), where x and y are the two specified numerical values. The first parameter passed to the function is the y-value and the second parameter is the x-value.
member.returns: An angle, measured in radians.

member.name: M:System.Data.Entity.SqlServerCompact.SqlCeFunctions.GetDate
member.summary: Returns the current database system timestamp as a datetime value without the database time zone offset. This value is derived from the operating system of the computer on which the instance of SQL Server is running.
member.returns: The current database timestamp.
